definition[0]: a short high electronic sound, or a flashing light on the screen of a piece of electronic equipment
definition[1]: a short pause or change in a process or activity, especially when the situation gets worse for a while before it improves again
example[1]: A government spokesman described the rise in inflation as a temporary blip.
definition[2]: a change in which a situation gets worse for a short time, and then usually gets better again soon afterwards
example[2]: These are definitely not short-term investments and not for anyone who panics every time there is a blip in the stock market.
